nd exists and the machi end of the sword, not the Kissaki end. That is

ething completely different again.

Richard

Richard Turner wrote:
=
>
> Hi Elliot, no offence, but do not try to confuse your sword with a Juyo=

> or higher sword unless yours is of the same level. The hamon running off=

> the kissaki IS a fatal flaw, make no bones about that. Swords with fatal=

> flaws that make Tokubetsu Hozon, Juyo or Yashu saku are swords of
> extr=
aordinary worth, and a flaw that is fatal can not take away it's
> history.=
 These swords are typically famous because they are rare, or
> were carried=
 by someone important or famous. General swords, made by the
> not so famou=
s sword smiths, no matter how nice will most likely fail all
> attempts at =
kanteisho if theirs is a fatal flaw like the hamon running
> off the Ha or =
Kissaki, a Hagiri and the likes.
>
> We all learn hard lessons and we never=
 like being told that our hard
> earned and well spent money if for naught,=
 but this is a mugs game, it
> takes nerves of steel and a firm resolve. Al=
l I can suggest is to get
> over it and move on. I mean that in the nicest =
possible way. I am not
> trying to be smart, just realistic.
>
> Good luck
=
>
> Richard Turner
